intro: Stelmesus, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant features palmately divided leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Despite its beauty, it contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
